slide.title: Resource Files 2/2
slide.blurb: The full syntax of the resources files is described online at:
Definining styles is not very difficult:
slide.example: style 'name ' [ = 'parent'] { fg[state] = <color> bg[state] = <color> base[state] = <color> text[state] = <color> bg_texts[state] = <color> font = <font> fontset = <font> }
slide.blurb: Where 'name' is the name you give this particular style, 'parent' is the name of the parent style the attributes of which this one will inherit. <color> can be specified as a string "#rrrrggggbbbb", "#rrrgggbbb", "#rrggbb", or "#rgb", where r g, and b are hex digits, or as a triplet of floats { r, g, b }.

Note that the wildcards are important: "**GtkScrolledWindow*" makes sure that it applies to the scroll window inside "main window" even if it's bundled in a box or something like that, and "**GtkButton**" says that the button can be packed up in a box and that the style will also apply to the child of the button, that is, label. Without the final asterisk the button label font would not be affected.
